member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.views.DocumentView.defaultView
member.summary: The default AbstractView for this Document, or null if none available.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.Node.hasChildNodes
member.summary: Returns whether this node has any children.
member.returns: true if this node has any children, false otherwise.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.Node.normalize
member.summary: Puts all Text nodes in the full depth of the sub-tree underneath this Node, including attribute nodes, into a "normal" form where only structure (e.g., elements, comments, processing instructions, CDATA sections, and entity references) separates Text nodes, i.e., there are neither adjacent Text nodes nor empty Text nodes. This can be used to ensure that the DOM view of a document is the same as if it were saved and re-loaded, and is useful when operations (such as XPointer lookups) that depend on a particular document tree structure are to be used.In cases where the document contains CDATASections, the normalize operation alone may not be sufficient, since XPointers do not differentiate between Text nodes and CDATASection nodes. @version DOM Level 2

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.Node.isSupported(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Tests whether the DOM implementation implements a specific feature and that feature is supported by this node.
member.param: name of the feature to test. This is the same name which can be passed to the method hasFeature on DOMImplementation.

is the version number of the feature to test. In Level 2, version 1, this is the string "2.0". If the version is not specified, supporting any version of the feature will cause the method to return true.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.Node.hasAttributes
member.summary: Returns whether this node (if it is an element) has any attributes.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.Node.nodeName
member.summary: The name of this node, depending on its type; see the table above.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.Node.nodeValue
member.summary: The value of this node, depending on its type; see the table above. When it is defined to be null, setting it has no effect.
member.exception: NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised when the node is readonly.
DOMSTRING_SIZE_ERR: Raised when it would return more characters than fit in a DOMString variable on the implementation platform.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.Node.nodeType
member.summary: A code representing the type of the underlying object, as defined above.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.Node.parentNode
member.summary: The parent of this node. All nodes, except Attr, Document, DocumentFragment, Entity, and Notation may have a parent. However, if a node has just been created and not yet added to the tree, or if it has been removed from the tree, this is null.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.Node.childNodes
member.summary: A NodeList that contains all children of this node. If there are no children, this is a NodeList containing no nodes.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.Node.firstChild
member.summary: The first child of this node. If there is no such node, this returns null.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.Node.lastChild
member.summary: The last child of this node. If there is no such node, this returns null.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.Node.previousSibling
member.summary: The node immediately preceding this node. If there is no such node, this returns null.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.Node.nextSibling
member.summary: The node immediately following this node. If there is no such node, this returns null.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.Node.attributes
member.summary: A NamedNodeMap containing the attributes of this node (if it is an Element) or null otherwise.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.Node.ownerDocument
member.summary: The Document object associated with this node. This is also the Document object used to create new nodes. When this node is a Document or a DocumentType which is not used with any Document yet, this is null. @version DOM Level 2

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.Element.getAttribute(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves an attribute value by name.
member.param: name of the attribute to retrieve.
member.returns: The Attr value as a string, or the empty string if that attribute does not have a specified or default value.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.Element.getElementsByTagName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a NodeList of all descendant Elements with a given tag name, in the order in which they are encountered in a preorder traversal of this Element tree.
member.param: name of the tag to match on. The special value "*" matches all tags.
member.returns: A list of matching Element nodes.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.Element.getAttributeNS(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves an attribute value by local name and namespace URI. HTML-only DOM implementations do not need to implement this method.
member.param: namespace URI of the attribute to retrieve.
local name of the attribute to retrieve.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.Element.getAttributeNodeNS(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves an Attr node by local name and namespace URI. HTML-only DOM implementations do not need to implement this method.
member.param: namespace URI of the attribute to retrieve.
local name of the attribute to retrieve.
member.returns: The Attr node with the specified attribute local name and namespace URI or null if there is no such attribute. @since DOM Level 2

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.Element.hasAttribute(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true when an attribute with a given name is specified on this element or has a default value, false otherwise.
member.param: name of the attribute to look for.
member.returns: true if an attribute with the given name is specified on this element or has a default value, false otherwise. @since DOM Level 2

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.Element.hasAttributeNS(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns true when an attribute with a given local name and namespace URI is specified on this element or has a default value, false otherwise. HTML-only DOM implementations do not need to implement this method.
member.param: namespace URI of the attribute to look for.
local name of the attribute to look for.
member.returns: true if an attribute with the given local name and namespace URI is specified or has a default value on this element, false otherwise. @since DOM Level 2

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.Element.tagName
member.summary:
The name of the element. For example, in:
<elementExample id="demo"> ... </elementExample> ,
tagName has the value "elementExample". Note that this is case-preserving in XML, as are all of the operations of the DOM. The HTML DOM returns the tagName of an HTML element in the canonical uppercase form, regardless of the case in the source HTML document.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.NodeList.item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the indexth item in the collection. If index is greater than or equal to the number of nodes in the list, this returns null.
member.param: into the collection.
member.returns: The node at the indexth position in the NodeList, or null if that is not a valid index.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.NodeList.length
member.summary: The number of nodes in the list. The range of valid child node indices is 0 to length-1 inclusive.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.DOMImplementation.hasFeature(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Test if the DOM implementation implements a specific feature.
member.param: name of the feature to test (case-insensitive). The values used by DOM features are defined throughout the DOM Level 2 specifications and listed in the section. The name must be an XML name. To avoid possible conflicts, as a convention, names referring to features defined outside the DOM specification should be made unique by reversing the name of the Internet domain name of the person (or the organization that the person belongs to) who defines the feature, component by component, and using this as a prefix. For instance, the W3C SVG Working Group defines the feature "org.w3c.dom.svg".

is the version number of the feature to test. In Level 2, the string can be either "2.0" or "1.0". If the version is not specified, supporting any version of the feature causes the method to return true.
member.returns: true if the feature is implemented in the specified version, false otherwise.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.events.Event.stopPropagation
member.summary: The stopPropagation method is used prevent further propagation of an event during event flow. If this method is called by any EventListener the event will cease propagating through the tree. The event will complete dispatch to all listeners on the current EventTarget before event flow stops. This method may be used during any stage of event flow.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.events.Event.preventDefault
member.summary: If an event is cancelable, the preventDefault method is used to signify that the event is to be canceled, meaning any default action normally taken by the implementation as a result of the event will not occur. If, during any stage of event flow, the preventDefault method is called the event is canceled. Any default action associated with the event will not occur. Calling this method for a non-cancelable event has no effect. Once preventDefault has been called it will remain in effect throughout the remainder of the event's propagation. This method may be used during any stage of event flow.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.events.Event.initEvent(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: The initEvent method is used to initialize the value of an Event created through the DocumentEvent interface. This method may only be called before the Event has been dispatched via the dispatchEvent method, though it may be called multiple times during that phase if necessary. If called multiple times the final invocation takes precedence. If called from a subclass of Event interface only the values specified in the initEvent method are modified, all other attributes are left unchanged.
member.param: the event type. This type may be any event type currently defined in this specification or a new event type.. The string must be an XML name. Any new event type must not begin with any upper, lower, or mixed case version of the string "DOM". This prefix is reserved for future DOM event sets. It is also strongly recommended that third parties adding their own events use their own prefix to avoid confusion and lessen the probability of conflicts with other new events.
whether or not the event can bubble.
whether or not the event's default action can be prevented.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.events.Event.type
member.summary: The name of the event (case-insensitive). The name must be an XML name.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.events.Event.target
member.summary: Used to indicate the EventTarget to which the event was originally dispatched.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.events.Event.currentTarget
member.summary: Used to indicate the EventTarget whose EventListeners are currently being processed. This is particularly useful during capturing and bubbling.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.events.Event.eventPhase
member.summary: Used to indicate which phase of event flow is currently being evaluated.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.events.Event.bubbles
member.summary: Used to indicate whether or not an event is a bubbling event. If the event can bubble the value is true, else the value is false.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.events.Event.cancelable
member.summary: Used to indicate whether or not an event can have its default action prevented. If the default action can be prevented the value is true, else the value is false.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.events.Event.timeStamp
member.summary: Used to specify the time (in milliseconds relative to the epoch) at which the event was created. Due to the fact that some systems may not provide this information the value of timeStamp may be not available for all events. When not available, a value of 0 will be returned. Examples of epoch time are the time of the system start or 0:0:0 UTC 1st January 1970.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.events.UIEvent.initUIEvent(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,org.w3c.dom.views.AbstractView,System.Int32)
member.summary: The initUIEvent method is used to initialize the value of a UIEvent created through the DocumentEvent interface. This method may only be called before the UIEvent has been dispatched via the dispatchEvent method, though it may be called multiple times during that phase if necessary. If called multiple times, the final invocation takes precedence.
member.param: the event type.
whether or not the event can bubble.
whether or not the event's default action can be prevented.
the Event's AbstractView.
the Event's detail.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.events.UIEvent.view
member.summary: The view attribute identifies the AbstractView from which the event was generated.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.events.UIEvent.detail
member.summary: Specifies some detail information about the Event, depending on the type of event.

member.name: F:org.w3c.dom.DOMException.INDEX_SIZE_ERR
member.summary: If index or size is negative, or greater than the allowed value

member.name: F:org.w3c.dom.DOMException.DOMSTRING_SIZE_ERR
member.summary: If the specified range of text does not fit into a DOMString

member.name: F:org.w3c.dom.DOMException.HIERARCHY_REQUEST_ERR
member.summary: If any node is inserted somewhere it doesn't belong

member.name: F:org.w3c.dom.DOMException.WRONG_DOCUMENT_ERR
member.summary: If a node is used in a different document than the one that created it (that doesn't support it)

member.name: F:org.w3c.dom.DOMException.INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR
member.summary: If an invalid or illegal character is specified, such as in a name. See production 2 in the XML specification for the definition of a legal character, and production 5 for the definition of a legal name character.

member.name: F:org.w3c.dom.DOMException.NO_DATA_ALLOWED_ERR
member.summary: If data is specified for a node which does not support data

member.name: F:org.w3c.dom.DOMException.NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR
member.summary: If an attempt is made to modify an object where modifications are not allowed

member.name: F:org.w3c.dom.DOMException.NOT_FOUND_ERR
member.summary: If an attempt is made to reference a node in a context where it does not exist

member.name: F:org.w3c.dom.DOMException.NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR
member.summary: If the implementation does not support the requested type of object or operation.

member.name: F:org.w3c.dom.DOMException.INUSE_ATTRIBUTE_ERR
member.summary: If an attempt is made to add an attribute that is already in use elsewhere

member.name: F:org.w3c.dom.DOMException.INVALID_STATE_ERR
F:org.w3c.dom.DOMException.SYNTAX_ERR
member.summary: If an invalid or illegal string is specified. @since DOM Level 2

member.name: F:org.w3c.dom.DOMException.INVALID_MODIFICATION_ERR
member.summary: If an attempt is made to modify the type of the underlying object. @since DOM Level 2

member.name: F:org.w3c.dom.DOMException.NAMESPACE_ERR
F:org.w3c.dom.DOMException.INVALID_ACCESS_ERR
M:org.w3c.dom.css.DOMImplementationCSS.createCSSStyleSheet(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new CSSStyleSheet.
member.param: The advisory title. See also the section.
The comma-separated list of media associated with the new style sheet. See also the section.
member.returns: A new CSS style sheet.
member.exception: SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the specified media string value has a syntax error and is unparsable.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSRule.type
member.summary: The type of the rule, as defined above. The expectation is that binding-specific casting methods can be used to cast down from an instance of the CSSRule interface to the specific derived interface implied by the type.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSRule.parentStyleSheet
member.summary: The style sheet that contains this rule.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSRule.parentRule
member.summary: If this rule is contained inside another rule (e.g. a style rule inside an @media block), this is the containing rule. If this rule is not nested inside any other rules, this returns null.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSFontFaceRule.style
member.summary: The declaration-block of this rule.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSMediaRule.media
member.summary: A list of media types for this rule.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSMediaRule.cssRules
member.summary: A list of all CSS rules contained within the media block.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.Notation.publicId
member.summary: The public identifier of this notation. If the public identifier was not specified, this is null.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.Notation.systemId
member.summary: The system identifier of this notation. If the system identifier was not specified, this is null.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.events.MouseEvent.initMouseEvent(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,org.w3c.dom.views.AbstractView,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int16,org.w3c.dom.events.EventTarget)
member.summary: The initMouseEvent method is used to initialize the value of a MouseEvent created through the DocumentEvent interface. This method may only be called before the MouseEvent has been dispatched via the dispatchEvent method, though it may be called multiple times during that phase if necessary. If called multiple times, the final invocation takes precedence.
member.param: the event type.
whether or not the event can bubble.
whether or not the event's default action can be prevented.
the Event's AbstractView.
the Event's mouse click count.
the Event's screen x coordinate
the Event's screen y coordinate
the Event's client x coordinate
the Event's client y coordinate
whether or not control key was depressed during the Event.
whether or not alt key was depressed during the Event.
whether or not shift key was depressed during the Event.
whether or not meta key was depressed during the Event.
the Event's mouse button.
the Event's related EventTarget.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.events.MouseEvent.screenX
member.summary: The horizontal coordinate at which the event occurred relative to the origin of the screen coordinate system.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.events.MouseEvent.screenY
member.summary: The vertical coordinate at which the event occurred relative to the origin of the screen coordinate system.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.events.MouseEvent.clientX
member.summary: The horizontal coordinate at which the event occurred relative to the DOM implementation's client area.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.events.MouseEvent.clientY
member.summary: The vertical coordinate at which the event occurred relative to the DOM implementation's client area.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.events.MouseEvent.ctrlKey
member.summary: Used to indicate whether the 'ctrl' key was depressed during the firing of the event.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.events.MouseEvent.shiftKey
member.summary: Used to indicate whether the 'shift' key was depressed during the firing of the event.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.events.MouseEvent.altKey
member.summary: Used to indicate whether the 'alt' key was depressed during the firing of the event. On some platforms this key may map to an alternative key name.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.events.MouseEvent.metaKey
member.summary: Used to indicate whether the 'meta' key was depressed during the firing of the event. On some platforms this key may map to an alternative key name.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.events.MouseEvent.button
member.summary: During mouse events caused by the depression or release of a mouse button, button is used to indicate which mouse button changed state. The values for button range from zero to indicate the left button of the mouse, one to indicate the middle button if present, and two to indicate the right button. For mice configured for left handed use in which the button actions are reversed the values are instead read from right to left.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.events.MouseEvent.relatedTarget
member.summary: Used to identify a secondary EventTarget related to a UI event. Currently this attribute is used with the mouseover event to indicate the EventTarget which the pointing device exited and with the mouseout event to indicate the EventTarget which the pointing device entered.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSRuleList.item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Used to retrieve a CSS rule by ordinal index. The order in this collection represents the order of the rules in the CSS style sheet. If index is greater than or equal to the number of rules in the list, this returns null.
member.param: into the collection
member.returns: The style rule at the index position in the CSSRuleList, or null if that is not a valid index.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSRuleList.length
member.summary: The number of CSSRules in the list. The range of valid child rule indices is 0 to length-1 inclusive.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.Document.createDocumentFragment
member.summary: Creates an empty DocumentFragment object.
member.returns: A new DocumentFragment.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.Document.createTextNode(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a Text node given the specified string.
member.param: data for the node.
member.returns: The new Text object.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.Document.createComment(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a Comment node given the specified string.
member.param: data for the node.
member.returns: The new Comment object.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.Document.createCDATASection(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a CDATASection node whose value is the specified string.
member.param: data for the CDATASection contents.
member.returns: The new CDATASection object.
member.exception: NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR: Raised if this document is an HTML document.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.Document.getElementsByTagName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a NodeList of all the Elements with a given tag name in the order in which they are encountered in a preorder traversal of the Document tree.
member.param: name of the tag to match on. The special value "*" matches all tags.
member.returns: A new NodeList object containing all the matched Elements.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.Document.getElementsByTagNameNS(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a NodeList of all the Elements with a given local name and namespace URI in the order in which they are encountered in a preorder traversal of the Document tree.
member.param: namespace URI of the elements to match on. The special value "*" matches all namespaces.
local name of the elements to match on. The special value "*" matches all local names.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.Document.getElementById(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the Element whose ID is given by elementId. If no such element exists, returns null. Behavior is not defined if more than one element has this ID. The DOM implementation must have information that says which attributes are of type ID. Attributes with the name "ID" are not of type ID unless so defined. Implementations that do not know whether attributes are of type ID or not are expected to return null.
member.param: unique id value for an element.
member.returns: The matching element. @since DOM Level 2

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.Document.doctype
member.summary: The Document Type Declaration (see DocumentType) associated with this document. For HTML documents as well as XML documents without a document type declaration this returns null. The DOM Level 2 does not support editing the Document Type Declaration. docType cannot be altered in any way, including through the use of methods inherited from the Node interface, such as insertNode or removeNode.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.Document.implementation
member.summary: The DOMImplementation object that handles this document. A DOM application may use objects from multiple implementations.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.Document.documentElement
member.summary: This is a convenience attribute that allows direct access to the child node that is the root element of the document. For HTML documents, this is the element with the tagName "HTML".

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.events.MutationEvent.initMutationEvent(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,org.w3c.dom.Node,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int16)
member.summary: The initMutationEvent method is used to initialize the value of a MutationEvent created through the DocumentEvent interface. This method may only be called before the MutationEvent has been dispatched via the dispatchEvent method, though it may be called multiple times during that phase if necessary. If called multiple times, the final invocation takes precedence.
member.param: the event type.
whether or not the event can bubble.
whether or not the event's default action can be prevented.
the Event's related Node.
the Event's prevValue attribute. This value may be null.
the Event's newValue attribute. This value may be null.
the Event's attrName attribute. This value may be null.
the Event's attrChange attribute

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.events.MutationEvent.relatedNode
member.summary: relatedNode is used to identify a secondary node related to a mutation event. For example, if a mutation event is dispatched to a node indicating that its parent has changed, the relatedNode is the changed parent. If an event is instead dispatched to a subtree indicating a node was changed within it, the relatedNode is the changed node. In the case of the DOMAttrModified event it indicates the Attr node which was modified, added, or removed.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.events.MutationEvent.prevValue
member.summary: prevValue indicates the previous value of the Attr node in DOMAttrModified events, and of the CharacterData node in DOMCharDataModified events.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.events.MutationEvent.newValue
member.summary: newValue indicates the new value of the Attr node in DOMAttrModified events, and of the CharacterData node in DOMCharDataModified events.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.events.MutationEvent.attrName
member.summary: attrName indicates the name of the changed Attr node in a DOMAttrModified event.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.events.MutationEvent.attrChange
member.summary: attrChange indicates the type of change which triggered the DOMAttrModified event. The values can be MODIFICATION , ADDITION, or REMOVAL.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.CharacterData.appendData(System.String)
member.summary: Append the string to the end of the character data of the node. Upon success, data provides access to the concatenation of data and the DOMString specified.
member.param: DOMString to append.
member.exception: NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this node is readonly.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.CharacterData.data
member.summary: The character data of the node that implements this interface. The DOM implementation may not put arbitrary limits on the amount of data that may be stored in a CharacterData node. However, implementation limits may mean that the entirety of a node's data may not fit into a single DOMString. In such cases, the user may call substringData to retrieve the data in appropriately sized pieces.
member.exception: NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised when the node is readonly.
DOMSTRING_SIZE_ERR: Raised when it would return more characters than fit in a DOMString variable on the implementation platform.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.CharacterData.length
member.summary: The number of 16-bit units that are available through data and the substringData method below. This may have the value zero, i.e., CharacterData nodes may be empty.

member.name: F:org.w3c.dom.events.EventException.UNSPECIFIED_EVENT_TYPE_ERR
member.summary: If the Event's type was not specified by initializing the event before the method was called. Specification of the Event's type as null or an empty string will also trigger this exception.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSValue.cssValueType
member.summary: A code defining the type of the value as defined above.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSValueList.item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Used to retrieve a CSSValue by ordinal index. The order in this collection represents the order of the values in the CSS style property. If index is greater than or equal to the number of values in the list, this returns null.
member.param: into the collection.
member.returns: The CSSValue at the index position in the CSSValueList, or null if that is not a valid index.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSValueList.length
member.summary: The number of CSSValues in the list. The range of valid values of the indices is 0 to length-1 inclusive.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.Counter.identifier
member.summary: This attribute is used for the identifier of the counter.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.Counter.listStyle
member.summary: This attribute is used for the style of the list.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.Counter.separator
member.summary: This attribute is used for the separator of the nested counters.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.ProcessingInstruction.target
member.summary: The target of this processing instruction. XML defines this as being the first token following the markup that begins the processing instruction.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.ProcessingInstruction.data
member.summary: The content of this processing instruction. This is from the first non white space character after the target to the character immediately preceding the ?>.
member.exception: NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised when the node is readonly.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.Entity.publicId
member.summary: The public identifier associated with the entity, if specified. If the public identifier was not specified, this is null.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.Entity.systemId
member.summary: The system identifier associated with the entity, if specified. If the system identifier was not specified, this is null.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.Entity.notationName
member.summary: For unparsed entities, the name of the notation for the entity. For parsed entities, this is null.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.Rect.top
member.summary: This attribute is used for the top of the rect.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.Rect.right
member.summary: This attribute is used for the right of the rect.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.Rect.bottom
member.summary: This attribute is used for the bottom of the rect.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.Rect.left
member.summary: This attribute is used for the left of the rect.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.stylesheets.DocumentStyle.styleSheets
member.summary: A list containing all the style sheets explicitly linked into or embedded in a document. For HTML documents, this includes external style sheets, included via the HTML LINK element, and inline STYLE elements. In XML, this includes external style sheets, included via style sheet processing instructions (see ).

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.css.DocumentCSS.getOverrideStyle(org.w3c.dom.Element,System.String)
member.summary: This method is used to retrieve the override style declaration for a specified element and a specified pseudo-element.
member.param: The element whose style is to be modified. This parameter cannot be null.
The pseudo-element or null if none.
member.returns: The override style declaration.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSImportRule.href
member.summary: The location of the style sheet to be imported. The attribute will not contain the "url(...)" specifier around the URI.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSImportRule.media
member.summary: A list of media types for which this style sheet may be used.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSImportRule.styleSheet
member.summary: The style sheet referred to by this rule, if it has been loaded. The value of this attribute is null if the style sheet has not yet been loaded or if it will not be loaded (e.g. if the style sheet is for a media type not supported by the user agent).

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.events.EventListener.handleEvent(org.w3c.dom.events.Event)
member.summary: This method is called whenever an event occurs of the type for which the EventListener interface was registered.
member.param: The Event contains contextual information about the event. It also contains the stopPropagation and preventDefault methods which are used in determining the event's flow and default action.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.views.AbstractView.document
member.summary: The source DocumentView of which this is an AbstractView.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.css.ViewCSS.getComputedStyle(org.w3c.dom.Element,System.String)
member.summary: This method is used to get the computed style as it is defined in .
member.param: The element whose style is to be computed. This parameter cannot be null.
The pseudo-element or null if none.
member.returns: The computed style. The CSSStyleDeclaration is read-only and contains only absolute values.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.stylesheets.StyleSheet.type
member.summary: This specifies the style sheet language for this style sheet. The style sheet language is specified as a content type (e.g. "text/css"). The content type is often specified in the ownerNode. Also see the type attribute definition for the LINK element in HTML 4.0, and the type pseudo-attribute for the XML style sheet processing instruction.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.stylesheets.StyleSheet.disabled
member.summary: false if the style sheet is applied to the document. true if it is not. Modifying this attribute may cause a new resolution of style for the document. A stylesheet only applies if both an appropriate medium definition is present and the disabled attribute is false. So, if the media doesn't apply to the current user agent, the disabled attribute is ignored.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.stylesheets.StyleSheet.ownerNode
member.summary: The node that associates this style sheet with the document. For HTML, this may be the corresponding LINK or STYLE element. For XML, it may be the linking processing instruction. For style sheets that are included by other style sheets, the value of this attribute is null.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.stylesheets.StyleSheet.parentStyleSheet
member.summary: For style sheet languages that support the concept of style sheet inclusion, this attribute represents the including style sheet, if one exists. If the style sheet is a top-level style sheet, or the style sheet language does not support inclusion, the value of this attribute is null.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.stylesheets.StyleSheet.href
member.summary: If the style sheet is a linked style sheet, the value of its attribute is its location. For inline style sheets, the value of this attribute is null. See the href attribute definition for the LINK element in HTML 4.0, and the href pseudo-attribute for the XML style sheet processing instruction.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.stylesheets.StyleSheet.title
member.summary: The advisory title. The title is often specified in the ownerNode. See the title attribute definition for the LINK element in HTML 4.0, and the title pseudo-attribute for the XML style sheet processing instruction.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.stylesheets.StyleSheet.media
member.summary: The intended destination media for style information. The media is often specified in the ownerNode. If no media has been specified, the MediaList will be empty. See the media attribute definition for the LINK element in HTML 4.0, and the media pseudo-attribute for the XML style sheet processing instruction . Modifying the media list may cause a change to the attribute disabled.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSStyleSheet.ownerRule
member.summary: If this style sheet comes from an @import rule, the ownerRule attribute will contain the CSSImportRule. In that case, the ownerNode attribute in the StyleSheet interface will be null. If the style sheet comes from an element or a processing instruction, the ownerRule attribute will be null and the ownerNode attribute will contain the Node.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSStyleSheet.cssRules
member.summary: The list of all CSS rules contained within the style sheet. This includes both rule sets and at-rules.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSStyleDeclaration.getPropertyValue(System.String)
member.summary: Used to retrieve the value of a CSS property if it has been explicitly set within this declaration block.
member.param: The name of the CSS property. See the CSS property index.
member.returns: Returns the value of the property if it has been explicitly set for this declaration block. Returns the empty string if the property has not been set.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSStyleDeclaration.getPropertyCSSValue(System.String)
member.summary: Used to retrieve the object representation of the value of a CSS property if it has been explicitly set within this declaration block. This method returns null if the property is a shorthand property. Shorthand property values can only be accessed and modified as strings, using the getPropertyValue and setProperty methods.
member.param: The name of the CSS property. See the CSS property index.
member.returns: Returns the value of the property if it has been explicitly set for this declaration block. Returns null if the property has not been set.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSStyleDeclaration.removeProperty(System.String)
member.summary: Used to remove a CSS property if it has been explicitly set within this declaration block.
member.param: The name of the CSS property. See the CSS property index.
member.returns: Returns the value of the property if it has been explicitly set for this declaration block. Returns the empty string if the property has not been set or the property name does not correspond to a known CSS property.
member.exception: NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this declaration is readonly or the property is readonly.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSStyleDeclaration.getPropertyPriority(System.String)
member.summary: Used to retrieve the priority of a CSS property (e.g. the "important" qualifier) if the property has been explicitly set in this declaration block.
member.param: The name of the CSS property. See the CSS property index.
member.returns: A string representing the priority (e.g. "important") if one exists. The empty string if none exists.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSStyleDeclaration.item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Used to retrieve the properties that have been explicitly set in this declaration block. The order of the properties retrieved using this method does not have to be the order in which they were set. This method can be used to iterate over all properties in this declaration block.
member.param: Index of the property name to retrieve.
member.returns: The name of the property at this ordinal position. The empty string if no property exists at this position.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSStyleDeclaration.length
member.summary: The number of properties that have been explicitly set in this declaration block. The range of valid indices is 0 to length-1 inclusive.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSStyleDeclaration.parentRule
member.summary: The CSS rule that contains this declaration block or null if this CSSStyleDeclaration is not attached to a CSSRule.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.traversal.TreeWalker.parentNode
member.summary: Moves to and returns the closest visible ancestor node of the current node. If the search for parentNode attempts to step upward from the TreeWalker's root node, or if it fails to find a visible ancestor node, this method retains the current position and returns null.
member.returns: The new parent node, or null if the current node has no parent in the TreeWalker's logical view.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.traversal.TreeWalker.firstChild
member.summary: Moves the TreeWalker to the first visible child of the current node, and returns the new node. If the current node has no visible children, returns null, and retains the current node.
member.returns: The new node, or null if the current node has no visible children in the TreeWalker's logical view.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.traversal.TreeWalker.lastChild
member.summary: Moves the TreeWalker to the last visible child of the current node, and returns the new node. If the current node has no visible children, returns null, and retains the current node.
member.returns: The new node, or null if the current node has no children in the TreeWalker's logical view.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.traversal.TreeWalker.previousSibling
member.summary: Moves the TreeWalker to the previous sibling of the current node, and returns the new node. If the current node has no visible previous sibling, returns null, and retains the current node.
member.returns: The new node, or null if the current node has no previous sibling. in the TreeWalker's logical view.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.traversal.TreeWalker.nextSibling
member.summary: Moves the TreeWalker to the next sibling of the current node, and returns the new node. If the current node has no visible next sibling, returns null, and retains the current node.
member.returns: The new node, or null if the current node has no next sibling. in the TreeWalker's logical view.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.traversal.TreeWalker.previousNode
member.summary: Moves the TreeWalker to the previous visible node in document order relative to the current node, and returns the new node. If the current node has no previous node, or if the search for previousNode attempts to step upward from the TreeWalker's root node, returns null, and retains the current node.
member.returns: The new node, or null if the current node has no previous node in the TreeWalker's logical view.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.traversal.TreeWalker.nextNode
member.summary: Moves the TreeWalker to the next visible node in document order relative to the current node, and returns the new node. If the current node has no next node, or if the search for nextNode attempts to step upward from the TreeWalker's root node, returns null, and retains the current node.
member.returns: The new node, or null if the current node has no next node in the TreeWalker's logical view.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.traversal.TreeWalker.root
member.summary: The root node of the TreeWalker, as specified when it was created.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.traversal.TreeWalker.whatToShow
member.summary: This attribute determines which node types are presented via the TreeWalker. The available set of constants is defined in the NodeFilter interface. Nodes not accepted by whatToShow will be skipped, but their children may still be considered. Note that this skip takes precedence over the filter, if any.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.traversal.TreeWalker.filter
member.summary: The filter used to screen nodes.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.stylesheets.MediaList.item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the indexth in the list. If index is greater than or equal to the number of media in the list, this returns null.
member.param: Index into the collection.
member.returns: The medium at the indexth position in the MediaList, or null if that is not a valid index.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.stylesheets.MediaList.length
member.summary: The number of media in the list. The range of valid media is 0 to length-1 inclusive.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.smil.ElementTimeControl.beginElement
member.summary: Causes this element to begin the local timeline (subject to restart constraints).
member.returns:
true if the method call was successful and the element was begun. false if the method call failed. Possible reasons for failure include:
The element does not support the beginElement method. The begin attribute is not set to "indefinite".
The element is already active and cannot be restarted when it is active. The restart attribute is set to "whenNotActive".
The element is active or has been active and cannot be restarted. The restart attribute is set to "never".
@raise DOMException SYNTAX_ERR: The element was not defined with the appropriate syntax to allow beginElement calls.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.smil.ElementTimeControl.beginElementAt(System.Single)
member.summary: Causes this element to begin the local timeline (subject to restart constraints), at the passed offset from the current time when the method is called. If the offset is >= 0, the semantics are equivalent to an event-base begin with the specified offset. If the offset is < 0, the semantics are equivalent to beginElement(), but the element active duration is evaluated as though the element had begun at the passed (negative) offset from the current time when the method is called.
member.param: The offset in seconds at which to begin the element.
member.returns:
true if the method call was successful and the element was begun. false if the method call failed. Possible reasons for failure include:
The element does not support the beginElementAt method. The begin attribute is not set to "indefinite".
The element is already active and cannot be restarted when it is active. The restart attribute is set to "whenNotActive".
The element is active or has been active and cannot be restarted. The restart attribute is set to "never".
@raise DOMException SYNTAX_ERR: The element was not defined with the appropriate syntax to allow beginElementAt calls.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.smil.ElementTimeControl.endElement
member.summary: Causes this element to end the local timeline.
member.returns:
true if the method call was successful and the element was ended. false if method call failed. Possible reasons for failure include:
The element does not support the endElement method. The end attribute is not set to "indefinite".
The element is not active.
@raise DOMException SYNTAX_ERR: The element was not defined with the appropriate syntax to allow endElement calls.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.smil.ElementTimeControl.endElementAt(System.Single)
member.summary: Causes this element to end the local timeline at the specified offset from the current time when the method is called
member.param: The offset in seconds at which to end the element. Must be >= 0.
member.returns:
true if the method call was successful and the element was ended. false if method call failed. Possible reasons for failure include:
The element does not support the endElementAt method. The end attribute is not set to "indefinite".
The element is not active.
@raise DOMException SYNTAX_ERR: The element was not defined with the appropriate syntax to allow endElementAt calls.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.ranges.Range.collapse(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Collapse a Range onto one of its boundary-points
member.param: TRUE, collapses the Range onto its start; if FALSE, collapses it onto its end.
member.exception: INVALID_STATE_ERR: Raised if detach() has already been invoked on this object.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.ranges.Range.selectNode(org.w3c.dom.Node)
member.summary: Select a node and its contents
member.param: node to select.
member.exception: INVALID_NODE_TYPE_ERR: Raised if an ancestor of refNode is an Entity, Notation or DocumentType node or if refNode is a Document, DocumentFragment, Attr, Entity, or Notation node.
INVALID_STATE_ERR: Raised if detach() has already been invoked on this object.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.ranges.Range.selectNodeContents(org.w3c.dom.Node)
member.summary: Select the contents within a node
member.param: to select from
member.exception: INVALID_NODE_TYPE_ERR: Raised if refNode or an ancestor of refNode is an Entity, Notation or DocumentType node.
INVALID_STATE_ERR: Raised if detach() has already been invoked on this object.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.ranges.Range.cloneRange
member.summary: Produces a new Range whose boundary-points are equal to the boundary-points of the Range.
member.returns: The duplicated Range.
member.exception: INVALID_STATE_ERR: Raised if detach() has already been invoked on this object.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.ranges.Range.ToString
member.summary: Returns the contents of a Range as a string. This string contains only the data characters, not any markup.
member.returns: The contents of the Range.
member.exception: INVALID_STATE_ERR: Raised if detach() has already been invoked on this object.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.ranges.Range.detach
member.summary: Called to indicate that the Range is no longer in use and that the implementation may relinquish any resources associated with this Range. Subsequent calls to any methods or attribute getters on this Range will result in a DOMException being thrown with an error code of INVALID_STATE_ERR.
member.exception: INVALID_STATE_ERR: Raised if detach() has already been invoked on this object.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.ranges.Range.startContainer
member.summary: Node within which the Range begins
member.exception: INVALID_STATE_ERR: Raised if detach() has already been invoked on this object.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.ranges.Range.startOffset
member.summary: Offset within the starting node of the Range.
member.exception: INVALID_STATE_ERR: Raised if detach() has already been invoked on this object.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.ranges.Range.endContainer
member.summary: Node within which the Range ends
member.exception: INVALID_STATE_ERR: Raised if detach() has already been invoked on this object.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.ranges.Range.endOffset
member.summary: Offset within the ending node of the Range.
member.exception: INVALID_STATE_ERR: Raised if detach() has already been invoked on this object.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.ranges.Range.collapsed
member.summary: TRUE if the Range is collapsed
member.exception: INVALID_STATE_ERR: Raised if detach() has already been invoked on this object.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.ranges.Range.commonAncestorContainer
member.summary: The deepest common ancestor container of the Range's two boundary-points.
member.exception: INVALID_STATE_ERR: Raised if detach() has already been invoked on this object.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.ranges.Range.startBefore
member.summary: Sets the start position to be before a node
member.param: starts before refNode
member.exception: INVALID_NODE_TYPE_ERR: Raised if the root container of refNode is not an Attr, Document, or DocumentFragment node or if refNode is a Document, DocumentFragment, Attr, Entity, or Notation node.
INVALID_STATE_ERR: Raised if detach() has already been invoked on this object.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.ranges.Range.startAfter
member.summary: Sets the start position to be after a node
member.param: starts after refNode
member.exception: INVALID_NODE_TYPE_ERR: Raised if the root container of refNode is not an Attr, Document, or DocumentFragment node or if refNode is a Document, DocumentFragment, Attr, Entity, or Notation node.
INVALID_STATE_ERR: Raised if detach() has already been invoked on this object.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.ranges.Range.endBefore
member.summary: Sets the end position to be before a node.
member.param: ends before refNode
member.exception: INVALID_NODE_TYPE_ERR: Raised if the root container of refNode is not an Attr, Document, or DocumentFragment node or if refNode is a Document, DocumentFragment, Attr, Entity, or Notation node.
INVALID_STATE_ERR: Raised if detach() has already been invoked on this object.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.ranges.Range.endAfter
member.summary: Sets the end of a Range to be after a node
member.param: ends after refNode.
member.exception: INVALID_NODE_TYPE_ERR: Raised if the root container of refNode is not an Attr, Document or DocumentFragment node or if refNode is a Document, DocumentFragment, Attr, Entity, or Notation node.
INVALID_STATE_ERR: Raised if detach() has already been invoked on this object.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.ranges.DocumentRange.createRange
member.summary: This interface can be obtained from the object implementing the Document interface using binding-specific casting methods.
member.returns: The initial state of the Range returned from this method is such that both of its boundary-points are positioned at the beginning of the corresponding Document, before any content. The Range returned can only be used to select content associated with this Document, or with DocumentFragments and Attrs for which this Document is the ownerDocument.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSPrimitiveValue.getFloatValue(System.Int16)
member.summary: This method is used to get a float value in a specified unit. If this CSS value doesn't contain a float value or can't be converted into the specified unit, a DOMException is raised.
member.param: A unit code to get the float value. The unit code can only be a float unit type (i.e. CSS_NUMBER, CSS_PERCENTAGE, CSS_EMS, CSS_EXS, CSS_PX, CSS_CM, CSS_MM, CSS_IN, CSS_PT, CSS_PC, CSS_DEG, CSS_RAD, CSS_GRAD, CSS_MS, CSS_S, CSS_HZ, CSS_KHZ, CSS_DIMENSION).
member.returns: The float value in the specified unit.
member.exception: INVALID_ACCESS_ERR: Raised if the CSS value doesn't contain a float value or if the float value can't be converted into the specified unit.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSPrimitiveValue.primitiveType
member.summary: The type of the value as defined by the constants specified above.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSPrimitiveValue.stringValue
member.summary: This method is used to get the string value. If the CSS value doesn't contain a string value, a DOMException is raised. Some properties (like 'font-family' or 'voice-family') convert a whitespace separated list of idents to a string.
member.returns: The string value in the current unit. The current primitiveType can only be a string unit type (i.e. CSS_STRING, CSS_URI, CSS_IDENT and CSS_ATTR).
member.exception: INVALID_ACCESS_ERR: Raised if the CSS value doesn't contain a string value.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSPrimitiveValue.counterValue
member.summary: This method is used to get the Counter value. If this CSS value doesn't contain a counter value, a DOMException is raised. Modification to the corresponding style property can be achieved using the Counter interface.
member.returns: The Counter value.
member.exception: INVALID_ACCESS_ERR: Raised if the CSS value doesn't contain a Counter value (e.g. this is not CSS_COUNTER).

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSPrimitiveValue.rectValue
member.summary: This method is used to get the Rect value. If this CSS value doesn't contain a rect value, a DOMException is raised. Modification to the corresponding style property can be achieved using the Rect interface.
member.returns: The Rect value.
member.exception: INVALID_ACCESS_ERR: Raised if the CSS value doesn't contain a Rect value. (e.g. this is not CSS_RECT).

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSPrimitiveValue.rGBColorValue
member.summary: This method is used to get the RGB color. If this CSS value doesn't contain a RGB color value, a DOMException is raised. Modification to the corresponding style property can be achieved using the RGBColor interface.
member.returns: the RGB color value.
member.exception: INVALID_ACCESS_ERR: Raised if the attached property can't return a RGB color value (e.g. this is not CSS_RGBCOLOR).

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.DocumentType.name
member.summary: The name of DTD; i.e., the name immediately following the DOCTYPE keyword.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.DocumentType.publicId
member.summary: The public identifier of the external subset. @since DOM Level 2

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.DocumentType.systemId
member.summary: The system identifier of the external subset. @since DOM Level 2

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.DocumentType.internalSubset
member.summary: The internal subset as a string.The actual content returned depends on how much information is available to the implementation. This may vary depending on various parameters, including the XML processor used to build the document. @since DOM Level 2

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.RGBColor.red
member.summary: This attribute is used for the red value of the RGB color.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.RGBColor.green
member.summary: This attribute is used for the green value of the RGB color.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.RGBColor.blue
member.summary: This attribute is used for the blue value of the RGB color.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.stylesheets.StyleSheetList.item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Used to retrieve a style sheet by ordinal index. If index is greater than or equal to the number of style sheets in the list, this returns null.
member.param: into the collection
member.returns: The style sheet at the index position in the StyleSheetList, or null if that is not a valid index.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.stylesheets.StyleSheetList.length
member.summary: The number of StyleSheets in the list. The range of valid child stylesheet indices is 0 to length-1 inclusive.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.smil.TimeEvent.view
member.summary: The view attribute identifies the AbstractView from which the event was generated.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.smil.TimeEvent.detail
member.summary: Specifies some detail information about the Event, depending on the type of event.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.traversal.DocumentTraversal.createNodeIterator(org.w3c.dom.Node,System.Int32,org.w3c.dom.traversal.NodeFilter,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a new NodeIterator over the subtree rooted at the specified node.
member.param: node which will be iterated together with its children. The iterator is initially positioned just before this node. The whatToShow flags and the filter, if any, are not considered when setting this position. The root must not be null.

flag specifies which node types may appear in the logical view of the tree presented by the iterator. See the description of NodeFilter for the set of possible SHOW_ values.These flags can be combined using OR.
NodeFilter to be used with this TreeWalker, or null to indicate no filter.
value of this flag determines whether entity reference nodes are expanded.
member.returns: The newly created NodeIterator.
member.exception: NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR: Raised if the specified root is null.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.traversal.DocumentTraversal.createTreeWalker(org.w3c.dom.Node,System.Int32,org.w3c.dom.traversal.NodeFilter,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a new TreeWalker over the subtree rooted at the specified node.
member.param: node which will serve as the root for the TreeWalker. The whatToShow flags and the NodeFilter are not considered when setting this value; any node type will be accepted as the root. The currentNode of the TreeWalker is initialized to this node, whether or not it is visible. The root functions as a stopping point for traversal methods that look upward in the document structure, such as parentNode and nextNode. The root must not be null.

flag specifies which node types may appear in the logical view of the tree presented by the tree-walker. See the description of NodeFilter for the set of possible SHOW_ values.These flags can be combined using OR.
NodeFilter to be used with this TreeWalker, or null to indicate no filter.
this flag is false, the contents of EntityReference nodes are not presented in the logical view.
member.returns: The newly created TreeWalker.
member.exception: NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR: Raised if the specified root is null.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.ElementCSSInlineStyle.style
member.summary: The style attribute.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.traversal.NodeFilter.acceptNode(org.w3c.dom.Node)
member.summary: Test whether a specified node is visible in the logical view of a TreeWalker or NodeIterator. This function will be called by the implementation of TreeWalker and NodeIterator; it is not normally called directly from user code. (Though you could do so if you wanted to use the same filter to guide your own application logic.)
member.param: node to check to see if it passes the filter or not.
member.returns: a constant to determine whether the node is accepted, rejected, or skipped, as defined above.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.stylesheets.LinkStyle.sheet
member.summary: The style sheet.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.traversal.NodeIterator.nextNode
member.summary: Returns the next node in the set and advances the position of the iterator in the set. After a NodeIterator is created, the first call to nextNode() returns the first node in the set.
member.returns: The next Node in the set being iterated over, or null if there are no more members in that set.
member.exception: INVALID_STATE_ERR: Raised if this method is called after the detach method was invoked.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.traversal.NodeIterator.previousNode
member.summary: Returns the previous node in the set and moves the position of the NodeIterator backwards in the set.
member.returns: The previous Node in the set being iterated over, or null if there are no more members in that set.
member.exception: INVALID_STATE_ERR: Raised if this method is called after the detach method was invoked.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.traversal.NodeIterator.detach
member.summary: Detaches the NodeIterator from the set which it iterated over, releasing any computational resources and placing the iterator in the INVALID state. After detach has been invoked, calls to nextNode or previousNode will raise the exception INVALID_STATE_ERR.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.traversal.NodeIterator.root
member.summary: The root node of the NodeIterator, as specified when it was created.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.traversal.NodeIterator.whatToShow
member.summary: This attribute determines which node types are presented via the iterator. The available set of constants is defined in the NodeFilter interface. Nodes not accepted by whatToShow will be skipped, but their children may still be considered. Note that this skip takes precedence over the filter, if any.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.traversal.NodeIterator.filter
member.summary: The NodeFilter used to screen nodes.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.events.DocumentEvent.createEvent(System.String)
member.param: eventType parameter specifies the type of Event interface to be created. If the Event interface specified is supported by the implementation this method will return a new Event of the interface type requested. If the Event is to be dispatched via the dispatchEvent method the appropriate event init method must be called after creation in order to initialize the Event's values. As an example, a user wishing to synthesize some kind of UIEvent would call createEvent with the parameter "UIEvents". The initUIEvent method could then be called on the newly created UIEvent to set the specific type of UIEvent to be dispatched and set its context information.The createEvent method is used in creating Events when it is either inconvenient or unnecessary for the user to create an Event themselves. In cases where the implementation provided Event is insufficient, users may supply their own Event implementations for use with the dispatchEvent method.
member.returns: The newly created Event
member.exception: NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR: Raised if the implementation does not support the type of Event interface requested

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSStyleRule.style
member.summary: The declaration-block of this rule set.

member.name: F:org.w3c.dom.ranges.RangeException.BAD_BOUNDARYPOINTS_ERR
member.summary: If the boundary-points of a Range do not meet specific requirements.

member.name: F:org.w3c.dom.ranges.RangeException.INVALID_NODE_TYPE_ERR
member.summary: If the container of an boundary-point of a Range is being set to either a node of an invalid type or a node with an ancestor of an invalid type.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.NamedNodeMap.getNamedItem(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a node specified by name.
member.param: nodeName of a node to retrieve.
member.returns: A Node (of any type) with the specified nodeName, or null if it does not identify any node in this map.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.NamedNodeMap.item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the indexth item in the map. If index is greater than or equal to the number of nodes in this map, this returns null.
member.param: into this map.
member.returns: The node at the indexth position in the map, or null if that is not a valid index.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.NamedNodeMap.getNamedItemNS(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a node specified by local name and namespace URI. HTML-only DOM implementations do not need to implement this method.
member.param: namespace URI of the node to retrieve.
local name of the node to retrieve.
member.returns: A Node (of any type) with the specified local name and namespace URI, or null if they do not identify any node in this map. @since DOM Level 2

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.NamedNodeMap.length
member.summary: The number of nodes in this map. The range of valid child node indices is 0 to length-1 inclusive.

member.name: M:org.w3c.dom.events.EventTarget.dispatchEvent(org.w3c.dom.events.Event)
member.summary: This method allows the dispatch of events into the implementations event model. Events dispatched in this manner will have the same capturing and bubbling behavior as events dispatched directly by the implementation. The target of the event is the EventTarget on which dispatchEvent is called.
member.param: the event type, behavior, and contextual information to be used in processing the event.
member.returns: The return value of dispatchEvent indicates whether any of the listeners which handled the event called preventDefault. If preventDefault was called the value is false, else the value is true.
member.exception: UNSPECIFIED_EVENT_TYPE_ERR: Raised if the Event's type was not specified by initializing the event before dispatchEvent was called. Specification of the Event's type as null or an empty string will also trigger this exception.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.Attr.name
member.summary: Returns the name of this attribute.

member.name: P:org.w3c.dom.Attr.ownerElement
P:org.w3c.dom.css.CSSPageRule.style
member.summary: The declaration-block of this rule.
